title: AI Digest — Global AI Race Heats Up, Plus Your New Morning Brief
name: Yi Qu
summary: This AI Digest highlights how the global race in AI is accelerating—spanning new models, major investments, and fast-moving policy and competition dynamics. It also delivers a quick “morning brief” of the most actionable updates so you can stay current without the noise.

title: Eliminate Manual Data Entry with an AI Agent That Auto-Fills Your Templates
name: Yi Qu
summary: Build an AI agent that reads raw data PDFs, extracts the values you care about, and auto-fills your Excel template without overwriting formulas—using embedded text first and OCR only when needed.

name: Yi Qu
summary: This digest covers Nvidia's $20 billion deal to license Groq's AI chip technology, OpenAI's launch of the ChatGPT App Directory, and AI's transformative impact on chemistry, labor markets, and the speed war between major AI labs.

title: You Don’t Need to Code to Build an AI Agent — One-Day Experience with Copilot Studio
name: Yi Qu
summary: Learn how to build AI agents without code using Microsoft Copilot Studio, a low-code/no-code tool. This post provides a practical summary of the 'Agent in a Day' session, covering key concepts like Solutions, Topics, Cards, and Agent Flows.

title: Build a Practical Make.com Automation: From Google Forms to AI Decisions
name: Yi Qu
summary: Learn a practical, reusable automation pattern using Google Forms, Apps Script, and Make.com to route survey responses, send thank-you emails, and use AI to analyze and summarize the results for a clean, decision-ready summary.

title: Stop Memorizing Stories: Use AI (Gemini 3) to Find Your Blind Spots Fast
name: Yi Qu
summary: Our most common learning illusion is this: you read an article, remember a story, and think you’ve “got it.” Learn a simple 3-step AI-style (Gemini 3) learning flow to find your blind spots fast.

name: Yi Qu

It also highlights the industrial revolution driven by AI in drug discovery with multiomics and OpenAI's move into e-commerce with a new shopping feature in ChatGPT.

title: The Hardest Part of Building an Enterprise AI Knowledge Base is Not Technology
name: Yi Qu
summary: Building an AI knowledge base is less about the technology (LLMs, vector databases) and more about the management of knowledge itself. The real challenge is ensuring the knowledge stays useful, trusted, and alive through effective capture of tacit knowledge, clear ownership, and building user trust.

title: The Three Skills That Actually Separate AI Engineers in Industry

summary: GitHub is a public library of modern tech ideas, from AI projects to new experiments, that often appear before they become popular on social media. Learn a simple routine to find real tools and trends.

title: How I Decide When to Split a Document for AI (and My Simple Rules)
excerpt: When I first used AI to search my notes, I dropped giant files into the system and hoped for magic. Instead, I got slow searches, vague answers, and sometimes the AI skipped the one section I needed. So I changed my approach. Now, before I upload anything, I pause and ask: Should I split this into smaller pieces, or keep it as one file?

title: Why I Did It with the Mindset of “AI First” (and Why Verification Matters)
name: Yi Qu

title: From Hobbyist to Enterprise: Mastering Workflow Automation with Make
name: Yi Qu
summary: In a session led by Make, the focus was on moving beyond simple task automation to implementing enterprise-grade governance, lifecycle management, and reliable AI integration for workflows. The session provided a technical deep dive into event-driven architecture using Google Apps Script and Webhooks, and outlined a critical scenario lifecycle for managing automations.

title: A Simple AI Tip: Use Built-In OCR Instead of Installing Your Own
name: Yi Qu
summary: Many AI assistants now include powerful Optical Character Recognition (OCR) built-in. This tip suggests using the AI's native OCR capabilities to convert images or PDFs with text into editable text, bypassing the need for separate, often complex, local OCR software like Tesseract.

title: Turn a Paper Business Card into a Phone Contact with AI
name: Yi Qu
summary: A simple, three-step guide on how to use an AI chat app (like ChatGPT) to quickly convert a physical business card into a digital phone contact (vCard file), eliminating manual typing and reducing errors.

title: How I Turn Scanned PDF Tables into Excel
name: Yi Qu
summary: A guide on using AI to extract data from scanned PDF tables and convert it into an Excel-ready format, focusing on the efficiency and accuracy of modern AI tools over traditional OCR methods.

title: 5 Google Agent Playbooks You Should Read
name: Yi Qu
summary: A short guide to five free whitepapers from Google and Kaggle (over 250 pages) on building real-world AI agents, covering agent basics, tools (MCP), memory, quality, and production. It provides a quick summary of each paper's key takeaways.

name: Yi Qu

title: AI Digest — Agents Take Over: The Shift from AI Tools to AI OS
name: Yi Qu
summary: Today's AI Digest covers the major shift from AI tools to 'agentic' systems that act as personal operating systems, the FDA's plan to use AI to speed up drug approval, the privacy concerns around AI wearable startups, and AI's power to find hidden stress signals in CT scans.

title: Dawn Song, Berkeley RDI, and the Rise of Agentic AI Education
name: Yi Qu
summary: A year ago, “agentic AI” was still insider language. In 2025, it became the fastest-moving layer of the AI stack—because it turns models into systems that can actually get work done.

title: What Is a Loss Function?
name: Yi Qu
summary: When we train a machine learning model, we need a way to measure how well it is doing. A loss function is simply a number that tells us how wrong the model is.

title: The Most Reliable Way to Build an AI-Powered Enterprise Information/Knowledge Manager
name: Yi Qu
summary: A guide to building a reliable enterprise AI knowledge base by separating storage (SharePoint) from retrieval (Structured Index), ensuring accurate, traceable, and scalable answers with Copilot, Databricks, and Microsoft Fabric.

title: AI Digest — AI's Economic Shift: Layoffs, Bubble Talk, and New Agentic Tools
name: Yi Qu
summary: Today's AI Digest covers the economic shift driven by AI, including job cuts at major tech companies, the debate over the AI investment 'bubble,' the release of Anthropic's open-source agentic framework 'Bloom,' and Al Jazeera's new AI-integrated news model.

title: From Prompt Engineering to Context Engineering: How to Get Better AI Results
name: Yi Qu
summary: The new advantage in getting better AI results isn't longer prompts, but context engineering—understanding what information the model needs so it doesn’t have to guess. This article outlines the shift and the four types of context that actually improve results.
